messages.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: What's the correlation between police funds and violent-crime trends?  Using the 10 most populous U.S. cities from the 2020 Census, list each city’s FY 2024 police-department budget (USD bn, keep one digit). Include sworn police officer headcounts in 2024, the 2023 violent-crime rate (per 100k residents), the 2023 Homicides (per 100k residents) and the 2024 mayor and his/her party. If a city uses a calendar-year budget, treat the 2024 calendar budget as FY 2024. Fill missing values with NA.
The crime rates and homicides should be rounded up to the nearest integer.

Please output one Markdown table with the columns in this order:
 City | FY 2024 Police Budget (USD bn) | Sworn Officers | 2023 Violent-Crime Rate | 2023 Homicides | 2024 Mayor | Party | Population (2020 Census)

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

To solve this problem, I need to gather accurate data for the 10 most populous U.S. cities from the 2020 Census regarding their FY 2024 police-department budgets, sworn officer headcounts, 2023 violent-crime rates, 2023 homicides, and the corresponding mayor and party affiliation. 

<search>10 most populous U.S. cities from the 2020 Census FY 2024 police-department budget USD bn sworn officers 2023 violent-crime rate 2023 homicides mayor party</search>

Search query: 10 most populous U.S. cities from the 2020 Census FY 2024 police-department budget USD bn sworn officers 2023 violent-crime rate 2023 homicides mayor party
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.census.gov/data/tables/time-series/demo/popest/2020s-total-cities-and-towns.html):
City and Town Population Totals: 2020-2024 This page features files containing city and town population for years 2020 to 2024. For the most recent data available, please refer to the Vintage 2024 data.

[Doc 2](https://www.facebook.com/WCBDNews2/posts/here-are-the-10-big-cities-with-the-highest-rate-of-crime-per-100000-people-base/1189752049853516/):
Here are the 10 big cities with the highest rate of crime per ... A 6.3 per 100,000 drop in homicides was noted in 2023, but violent crime persists. - ... Details: Detroit's high violent crime rate (39.7 murders ...

[Doc 3](https://stateline.org/2025/10/17/trump-isnt-sending-troops-to-cities-with-highest-crime-rates-data-shows/):
Trump isn't sending troops to cities with highest crime rates ... Overall violent and property crime rates were lower in 2024 than in 2023, and the homicide rate declined slightly from about 12 to 11 per ...
